column4: Is there a way to install Windows XP Pro on a machine that only has Ubuntu on it without having to reformat and start from scratch?
you can resize partitions with gparted, then when you have free space, install xp to that gap
you will need to reinstall grub though as xp will write the bootsector with its own
: so thats all? ...
yeah
: but how can I resize the partition when I am booted into it?
you boot to livecd
: ok... thanks
did you have xp installed first then install ubuntu?
i only have qt4-dev not opengl. i think you need to add a repo
: but its used to be in the ubuntu repos ....
try tab completing the package name
I downloaded it from http://packages.ubuntu.com/hardy-backports/libdevel/libqt4-opengl-dev
I found a bug report on this package ... it says "Fix Released .... but where is the fix? https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/qt4-x11/+bug/228148
The files are 100% the same
in this How-To it says I need I need to install that file http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=885201
you need to sudo dpkg --force-overwrite -i <filename> to install it
will forcing it screw anything else up?
dont think so, id look deeper
http://pastebin.com/d4156554d
you could try --force-all
my software index is broken ... how do I fix it ?
sudo apt-get -f install
